abstract.description: The CMS-specific CERN Virtual Machine has been tested on several operating systems, VM softwares and hardware configurations. This report contains a full list of tested machines and configurations as October 2014.

title: Validation report for CERN VM images

abstract.description: To access the help page for the CMS histogramming tool, click on "Need help?" in the top right corner of the page.

title: Explore CMS open data and play with the histograms - Help

abstract.description: To access the help page for the CMS event display, click on "Need help?" in the top right corner of the page.

title: Explore CMS open data and visualise detector events - Help

abstract.description: Monte Carlo simulation of pile-up is controlled by the code and configuration files of the package  SimGeneral/MixingModule. An input distribution is specified for each set of production samples which is supposed to represent the distribution of the mean number of interactions seen during data-taking. Below you can find more information on how the simulation proceeds:
Below you can find information related to CMS Simulated Dataset Names:

During the High School Teacher Programme in 2016 at CERN, a working group prepared worksheets and instructions on the use of open data in schools. Different aspects of open data were addressed: visualisation of single events, data analysis in spreadsheets and data analysis in python on jupyter notebooks. These files are the result of the working group and they can be used as inspiration for class room activities.

title: Worksheets and instructions for schools prepared during the High School Teacher Programme 2016
